text:
e="preserve">Larry Willoughby (1947 – January 14, 2021) was an American country music singer-songwriter and music businessman. He was the vice president of A&R at Capitol Records. He was born in Sherman, Texas. Willoughby's debut album, "Building Bridges", was released in 1984 by Atlantic America.
Willoughby died of COVID-19 on January 14, 2021.
